articles.title: National Meeting Held to Commemorate Kim Il Sung's Birth Anniversary
Kim Yong Nam's Report at National Meeting
To Increase Military Deterrent Is DPRK's Right for Self-Defense: Kim Yong Nam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam's Report at National Meeting 
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, made a report at a national meeting held here today to commemorate the 94th birth anniversary of President  Kim Il Sung.
 He stressed the need for all party members, servicepersons and people of the DPRK to firmly arm themselves with the Juche idea, purely maintain and develop the revolutionary traditions of Juche and the revolutionary leadership exploits established by      Kim Il Sung and carry out the revolution and construction the way he did, as required by his revolutionary idea, in any storm and stress.    
 It is a decisive guarantee for glorifying the history of the President, the sun of the nation, generation after generation to defend leader Kim Jong Il politically and ideologically at the cost of lives and remain loyal to his idea and leadership, he added.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets President of Kyodo News
Dismantlement of "UN Command" in S. Korea Called for
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets President of Kyodo News     Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a conversation with the delegation of Kyodo News of Japan and newspapers which subscribe to it led by President of the Kyodo News Satoshi Ishikawa at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 On hand were Hong Son Ok, vice-chairwoman of the Korean Society for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Pyong Ho, deputy director general of the Korean Central News Agency, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Moves to Conclude FTA under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
Dismantlement of "UN Command" in S. Korea Called for 
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- To dismantle the "UN Command" illegally kept in south Korea for more than half a century should be the first object of the UN reform.
 The DPRK delegate said this in a speech at a meeting of the Special Committee on the UN Charter and the Enhancement of Organization Role on April 3.
 The special committee should pay special attention to dissolving such an illegal organization as the "UN Command" in south Korea, he said, and went on:
 The "UN Command" illegally framed up by the United States, abusing the name of the UN, is not only laying obstacles in the settlement of the Korean issue but impairing the confidence in the UN.    
 The 30th UN General Assembly session admitted the unnecessariness of keeping the "UN Command" in south Korea and adopted a resolution on its dismantlement.
 And the UN recently made it clear that the "UN Command" in south Korea is not the UN forces but the U.S.-led army which is not under any UN command.
 Nevertheless, the U.S. is insisting on the continued existence of the "UN Command" in south Korea, which is aimed to continue to abuse the name of the UN in a bid to maintain its military hegemony in the Korean Peninsula and Northeast Asia.
 The DPRK delegation demands a clear removal of the traces that the name of the UN has been abused for an impure political and military objective in the past century through the current UN reform.

articles.title: Documentary Film Screened on Occasion of Day of Sun
articles.content:
Moves to Conclude FTA under Fire in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Kwon Yong Gil, a "national assemblyman" from the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea, on April 10 criticized the moves to conclude the south Korea-U.S. "Free Trade Agreement" (FTA), south Korean CBS reported.
 He said that the conclusion of FTA would bring serious grave consequences to the educational, medical, financial and other fields.    
 Accusing the authorities of rapidly pushing ahead with the negotiations for the conclusion of FTA, he asserted that FTA should go through screening by the people without fail.

articles.title: Grand Medal and Its Certificate Conferred upon Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Documentary Film Screened on Occasion of Day of Sun 
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- A documentary film "The Fatherly Leader among Officials" was screened at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday on the occasion of the Day of the Sun.
 It deals with historical facts that President Kim Il Sung brought up ordinary workers, farmers and intellectuals as able commanding personnel of revolution with profound loving care and bestowed great benevolence upon them from the early period of building a new country till the last moments of his life.    
 The film impressively tells about the warm care shown by the President for the officials to help them stoutly follow the road of revolution under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea with fidelity to the Party and the revolution, devotion, persevering spirit and practical ability and popular work style. 
 It was appreciated by Kim Yong Nam and Pak Pong Ju and other senior officials, members of the Cabinet and officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions.

Cambodian King to Visit DPRK
    Pyongyang, April 14 (KCNA) -- Norodom Sihamoni, king of Cambodia, will shortly pay an official visit to the DPRK upon the invitation of Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
